title: Supermodel Elle Macpherson, 55, shares string of make-up free selfies
text:
She's one of the most well-known supermodels in the world.

And Elle Macpherson has proved she's still got it, as the 55-year-old shared a string of age-defying selfies this week - without a scrap of make-up on her stunning visage.

The mother-of-two took to Instagram to share the jaw-dropping images, slipping into her comfortable pajamas before taking two natural selfies in the mirror.

Natural beauty! Elle Macpherson, 55, (pictured) shared a string of selfies flaunting her make-up free visage this week

She then posted a third photo, which showed the Australian personality posing in her car and showing off her incredibly slender frame in a one-shoulder top.

Later on, and a fourth shot saw Elle's eyes peeping over Demi Moore's new memoir, Inside Out.

She was pictured sporting wet hair and a pair of oversized reading glasses, again wearing nothing on her face.

Flashing the flesh! Elle took to Instagram to share a jaw-dropping snap showing off her very svelte frame and tiny waist

Bit of light reading, Elle? The former Friends actress was later pictured sporting wet hair and a pair of oversized reading glasses, again without a scrap of make-up on her stunning face

Hot mama! The mother-of-two posed up a storm in her bedroom, as she gave fans a glimpse into her life

The photos come after Elle recently opened up about her career in the cut-throat modelling industry, and gave her advice on how to succeed.

Speaking to The Daily Telegraph on Wednesday Elle said models need to be 'down to earth' and approachable in order to succeed in the age of social media.

'[In the past] the more iconic you were, the more distanced you were from your public, the greater your success,' she said.

Passing on the baton! Elle recently opened up about her career in the cut-throat modelling industry, and gave advice on how to succeed

'Today, the more relatable you are, the more connected you are to your public, the greater your success.'

The Aussie stunner, who now has an incredibly successful fashion and lingerie line, said that models need to be approachable.

'I think that the models that have been able to transition in this period have been girls that have been willing to get off the pedestal, and come back down to earth,' she added.

Helpful! '[In the past] the more iconic you were, the more distanced you were from your public, the greater your success,' she said. 'Today, the more relatable you are, the more connected you are to your public, the greater your success'
description: She's one of the most well-known supermodels in the world.
authors: Nicole Douglas For Daily Mail Australia
